dialogue.speaker: Stressed Stranger
dialogue.text: Excuse me, is this the right platform for downtown?

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: It is. The train comes when it comes. There's a bench here if you'd like to wait with intention rather than anxiety.

dialogue.speaker: Stressed Stranger
dialogue.text: I can't wait. I'm already late. Everything's falling apart.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I've found that everything falls apart exactly when it needs to. Like leaves in autumn, making room for new growth.

dialogue.speaker: Stressed Stranger
dialogue.text: That's... I never thought of it that way. You seem so calm.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: I'm just someone who learned that missing one train usually means you're perfectly on time for another journey entirely.

actions.action: stands on platform like a lighthouse, steady in the storm of rush hour
gradually slows down, matching Evan's calmer rhythm
rush past, some pausing briefly in the bubble of calm
arrives exactly when it needs to, neither late nor early

environment.description: Subway platform during evening rush, transformed into accidental wisdom school
environment.mood: urban anxiety meeting centered presence, public space becoming sacred
